alert.note: Alert for Apache; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 29 at 12:17PM MST until July 29 at 3:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Navajo County in north central Arizona... Apache County in northeastern Arizona... * Until 315 PM MST. * At 1216 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Chinle, Tselani-Cottonwood, Del Muerto, Salina, Nazlini, Canyon De Chelly National Monument, Blue Gap Chapter House, Burnside, Steamboat, Steamboat Canyon, Whippoorwill Chapter House, Sehili, Low Mountain, Wheatfields, Upper Wheatfields, Red Lake Chapter House, Many Farms, Many Farms Lake, Rough Rock and Tsaile. This includes the following highways... State Route 264 between mile markers 426 and 442. Highway 191 between mile markers 418 and 468. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Beshbito Wash, Lone Tule Wash, Cottonwood Wash, Oraibi Wash, Red Clay Wash, White Water Wash, Tse Ba Ni Zi Ni Wash, Sage House Wash, Agua Sal Creek, Bitter Water Wash, Nazlini Wash, Bis Ii Ah Wash, Buell Wash, Jeddito Wash, Sitting Giant Rock Wash, Tse Deeshzhaai Wash, Ruin Wash, Black Rock Canyon, Balakai Wash, Burro Wash, Keams Canyon Wash, Quartzite Canyon, Greasewood Wash, Trading Post Wash, Black Mountain Wash, Whiskey Creek, Tiis Ndiitsooi Wash, Chinle Wash, Muerto, Canyon del, Wheatfields Creek, Coyote Wash, Hipbone Wash, Polacca Wash, Tezinie Wash, Tse Chizzi Wash, Steamboat Wash, Wepo Wash, Lukachukai Creek, Pueblo Colorado Wash, Black Creek, Sheep Dip Creek, Tah Chee Wash, Lizard Wash, Burnt Corn Wash and Bonito Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well.
